paragraphs: O, how shall I remember you, or where shall I place you,
Among the heavenly, Hero, equal to the Gods?
For if you pour out nectar-like words from your chest,
The lively tongue of Atlas's daughter lies silent.
If you sing with Aonian waters, and are famous for the Muses,
Phoebus is stunned by the murmur of your words.
If you rule over the people with power, and control them with law,
Sweet Love himself rules the hearts of the people.
Or if you strike easily to help in broken matters,
Jupiter is said to wonder at such great gifts.
If fame lifts noble souls to the stars,
The name of man itself learns to lift the Aonians.
How well you turn the Geniuses of Virtue into all,
How well you unfold riches in the name of virtue.
Either renowned virtue has brought you forth in great birth,
Or you are said to be the parent of virtue.
